intro: Cousinia cisdarvasica, commonly known as the Cisdarvasica globemallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and is native to the arid regions of Central Asia. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Cousinia cisdarvasica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient, well-drained conditions.
